.. _`Troubleshooting`:

Troubleshooting
===============
This section describes some common issues that can arise and possible solutions.

Issue #1
--------
<Get to Main>
<Ensure you use the CD command to get to main before pulling anything so that changes reflect to all branches made>

Issue #2
--------
<Create .env file>
<Use nano <file-name> command in terminal to open a text editor and easily create the file needed>

Issue #3
--------
<Virtual Environment>
<Use python3 -m <name> .venv to create a virtual environment and then use . .venv/bin/activate to enable, you should see .venv next to terminal>
